intro: Syngonanthus duidae var. humilis, commonly known as the dwarf sedge, is a low-growing perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically forms dense mats of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its compact growth habit, it is sometimes used in ornamental gardening for its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for small organisms.
